item.title: 随着降息押注减弱，国债将在本周结束时震荡走高
item.description: 在受到经济数据的冲击后，本周国债将以强劲的走势收尾，交易员们一致押注美联储将在下个月降息四分之一个百分点。【原文：Treasuries were set to end the week on a strong note after being whipsawed by economic data, with traders coalescing around bets the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates by a quarter-point next month.】

item.title: 加沙停火谈判继续进行，布林肯将访问以色列
item.description: 国务卿安东尼-布林肯（Antony Blinken）将于本周末前往以色列，参加新一轮旨在阻止以色列-哈马斯战争的会谈。【原文：Secretary of State Antony Blinken will travel to Israel this weekend following a fresh round of talks to halt the Israel-Hamas war, as officials keep working to deter a threatened attack by Iran.】

item.title: 奇数通讯：我们将在杰克逊霍尔学到什么
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货》周刊，乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。特蕾西本周出刊。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and economy. Tracy is out this week.】

item.title: 加州计划发行 25 亿美元免税债券
item.description: 加利福尼亚州计划在本月晚些时候出售 25 亿美元的免税普通义务债券，这是该州今年发行的第二大债券。【原文：California is planning to sell $2.5 billion of tax-exempt general obligation bonds later this month, the state’s second largest offering this year.】

item.title: 投资者等待批准，Emergent 领涨与 Mpox 相关的股票
item.description: 本周，Emergent BioSolutions 公司引领了疫苗和抗病毒产品公司股票的上涨，因为投资者正在等待美国监管机构关于其天花疫苗是否也可用于快速传播的麻疹病毒的消息。【原文：Emergent BioSolutions Inc. led an advance in the stocks of companies working on vaccines and antiviral products this week as investors await word from US regulators on if its smallpox vaccine can also be used for the fast-spreading mpox virus.】

item.title: 耐克期待八年来最长连胜记录，情绪发生转变
item.description: 耐克公司的股价在 6 月底因销售预期疲软而受到重创，但在一系列利好消息的推动下，该公司股价目前有望创下八年多来最长的连胜纪录。【原文：Battered in late June after a weak sales forecast, Nike Inc. shares are now on track for their longest winning streak in more than eight years, propelled higher by a torrent of positive developments.】

item.title: 双线瞄准拉美新星，回避中国债务
item.description: 杰弗里-冈德拉克（Jeffrey Gundlach）的双线资本公司（DoubleLine Capital）的旗舰新兴市场债务基金正在大量购买危地马拉和巴拉圭的债券，同时放弃风险较高的信贷。【原文：The flagship emerging-market debt fund from Jeffrey Gundlach’s DoubleLine Capital is loading up on bonds from Guatemala and Paraguay as it ditches riskier credits.】

item.title: Maravai Lifesciences 收到收购要约后股价飙升
item.description: 马拉维生命科学控股公司（Maravai Lifesciences Holdings Inc.【原文：Maravai Lifesciences Holdings Inc. shares soared after a report that the company received a takeover offer from Repligen Corp.】

item.title: 债券市场在波动中自我反驳
item.description:
本周美国经济表现不俗。【原文：

This week brings tales of a US economy that’s doing pretty well.

】

item.title: Toscafund 聘用 Ryan Squillante 为北美地区主管
item.description: Toscafund 资产管理公司（Toscafund Asset Management）聘请了一位新的北美地区主管，这家以长线投资为主的投资者希望抓住 9 月份股票资本市场活动预期增加的机遇。【原文：Toscafund Asset Management has hired a new head of North America, as the predominantly long-only investor looks to capitalize on an expected rise in equity capital markets activity come September.】

item.title: 英国塞兹韦尔 C 核电厂投资决策有可能拖至 2025 年
item.description: 由于英国大选后与私人投资者的谈判时间比预期的要长，英国下一座大型核电站 Sizewell C 的最终投资决策有可能推迟到明年。【原文：A final investment decision in Britain’s next large-scale nuclear power plant, Sizewell C, risks getting pushed into next year as negotiations with private investors are taking longer than anticipated following the UK election.】

item.title: 德国要求 Uniper 为危机救助支付更多款项
item.description: 德国要求国有化能源公司 Uniper SE 在 2022 年偿还更多的救助资金，因为德国正试图填补预算漏洞。【原文：Germany is demanding higher repayments from nationalized energy company Uniper SE for a bailout in 2022, as the state tries to plug a hole in its budget.】

item.title: 加拿大房屋开工量意外跃升至 13 个月新高
item.description: 加拿大的住房开工率出人意料地升至一年多来的最高水平。【原文：Canada’s housing starts surprisingly rose to the highest level in more than a year.】

item.title: 美联储加息前景令现货黄金攀升至历史新高
item.description: 现货黄金升至历史新高，这主要是受到美国联邦储备委员会（US Federal Reserve）正逐步接近降息的希望所推动。【原文：Spot gold rose to an all-time high, bolstered by hopes that the US Federal Reserve is edging closer to cutting interest rates.】

item.title: 阿拉比卡因供应担忧而创下一个月来最大单周涨幅
item.description: 在纽约，阿拉比卡咖啡期货创下了一个多月以来的最大单周涨幅，原因是人们担心头号生产国巴西的供应会支撑咖啡价格。【原文：Arabica coffee futures were headed for their biggest weekly gain in more than a month in New York as fears over supplies in top producer Brazil supported prices.】

item.title: 波兰财政部长对 2025 年经济增长持更乐观态度
item.description: 波兰财政部长安杰伊-多曼斯基（Andrzej Domanski）表示，在欧盟援助流入和国内利率降低的预期下，波兰经济明年将增长近 4%。【原文：Poland’s economy is set to expand by nearly 4% next year amid expectations for inflows of European Union aid and lower domestic interest rates, according to Finance Minister Andrzej Domanski.】

item.title: 南非冻结核计划，以便开展公共进程
item.description: 南非电力部长表示，南非正在冻结一项从核电资源获取更多电力的计划，以便让更多的公众参与其中，从而提高透明度。【原文：South Africa is freezing a plan to obtain more electricity from nuclear sources to allow it to include additional public participation in a move to boost transparency, the nation’s electricity minister said.】

item.title: 陷入困境的巴西航空公司因货币和气候问题蒙受损失
item.description: 巴西航空公司本已在高利率和燃料成本波动的困境中挣扎，又因货币困境和气候挑战考验着该行业的运营韧性，蒙受了更多损失。【原文：Brazilian airlines, already struggling with high interest rates and volatile fuel costs, are being hit with more losses as currency woes and climate challenges test the sector’s operational resilience.】

item.title: 欧洲首家 LFP 电池千兆工厂在存储市场激增中开业
item.description: 莫罗电池公司（Morrow Batteries AS）正在为欧洲首家磷酸铁锂电池千兆工厂敞开大门，该公司正在加紧生产，以寻求 15 亿克朗（1.4 亿美元）的政府资金和足够的客户来满足其第一年全年的产量。【原文：Morrow Batteries AS is opening the doors to Europe’s first gigafactory for lithium-iron phosphate batteries, as it ramps up production in the hunt for 1.5 billion kroner ($140 million) in government funding and enough customers to cover its first full year of output.】

item.title: 美国新房建设速度降至 2020 年 5 月以来最慢
item.description: 由于需求疲软导致库存水平居高不下，美国 7 月份的新屋建设降至大流行病后的最低水平。【原文：New-home construction in the US fell in July to the lowest level since the aftermath of the pandemic as builders respond to weak demand that’s keeping inventory levels high.】

item.title: 加沙停火有望使谢克尔迈向 2024 年最佳月份
item.description: 周五，以色列货币在九天内第八次上涨，因为在卡塔尔开始停火谈判后，和平的希望更加强烈。【原文：Israel’s currency rose for the eighth time in nine days on Friday as hopes for peace strengthened on the start of cease-fire talks in Qatar.】

item.title: 加纳就向可可贸易商借款 5 亿美元展开谈判
item.description: 加纳正在与可可贸易商商谈借款 5 亿美元，为行业运营提供资金，因为在作物产量不确定的情况下，加纳面临着从其惯常贷款人处获得年度银团贷款的延迟。【原文：Ghana is talking with cocoa traders to borrow $500 million to finance industry operations, as it faces delays in concluding an annual syndicated loan from its usual lenders amid uncertainty over crop output.】

item.title: 您能用七条或更少的线索解开这个内幕交易之谜吗？
item.description:
请随身携带纸笔。【原文：

Keep your pen and paper handy.

】

item.title: 中国钢铁巨头终于屈服于现实
item.description:
随着世界第二大经济体的降温，即使是其工业巨头也必须做出调整。【原文：

As the world’s second-largest economy cools, even its industrial behemoths must adapt.

】

item.title: 曼氏集团的经济学家们正乘着私人热潮进行公开股票交易
item.description: Man Group Plc 的定量交易员打赌，解开私人市场的秘密将使他们在交易上市股票时更具优势。【原文：Quant traders at Man Group Plc are betting that unlocking the secrets of private markets will give them an edge in trading public stocks.】

item.title: 马克龙将在下周五任命总理前会见各党首脑
item.description: 埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）召集各政党领导人于8月23日举行会议，讨论法国政坛连续数周陷入僵局的紧急选举后新政府的组成问题。【原文：Emmanuel Macron has called a meeting with party leaders on Aug. 23 to discuss the composition of a new government following snap elections that have left French politics in limbo for weeks.】

item.title: 富人的艺术品卖不出去，所以他们借钱来抵债
item.description: 美国银行（Bank of America Corp.）的一位富裕客户将他的美术收藏公之于众，这样他就能借到足够的钱来购买一家体育特许经营公司。另一位客户将自己收藏的 19 世纪美国风景画拿出来翻新自己的庄园。【原文：A wealthy client at Bank of America Corp. put up his fine-art collection so he could borrow enough to buy a sports franchise. Another posted his cache of 19th century American landscapes to renovate his estate.】

item.title: S&P称不良交易所达到2009年以来最高水平
item.description: 据S&P全球评级公司（S&P Global Ratings）的一份报告称，不良交易所仍是今年违约的主要原因，其违约率达到2009年以来的最高点，部分原因是违约不止一次的公司造成的。【原文：Distressed exchanges remain the leading cause of defaults this year and are at their highest since 2009, driven partly by companies that have defaulted more than once, according to a report by S&P Global Ratings.】

item.title: 破产的英国议会指控商人挥霍数百万英镑
item.description: 英国一个破产的议会起诉了一位太阳能电池板企业家，指责他挪用多达 1.5 亿英镑（1.93 亿美元）的资金来资助自己奢侈的生活方式。【原文：A bankrupt English council sued a solar-panel entrepreneur it blames for funneling off as much as £150 million ($193 million) to fund his lavish lifestyle.】

item.title: 英国地方政府考虑罕见地涉足市政债券市场
item.description: 兰开夏郡希望重返市政债券市场，这将是英国四年来第一笔地方政府债券交易。【原文：The county of Lancashire is eyeing a return to the municipal bond market in what would be the UK’s first local authority deal in four years.】
